result.execSummary:
The defendant Blake A Reeves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Blake A Reeves is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Blake A Reeves was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Blake A Reeves was found guilty of OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Granting travel out of the Country from 7/22/17 to 7/29/17 signed by Judge Aprahamian 3/27/17.

From Atty Kuhary dated 3/23/17 requesting permission for defendant to travel out of the Country 7/22/17 to 7/29/17.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 3/23/17; Granted.
Character letter filed.

Defendant Blake A Reeves in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court confirms Counts #1, #4 were dismissed and read in and Count #5 is dismissed by operation of law. The defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 2:

HUBER:  60 Days with standard release conditions (consecutive to 15CF589) .

COSTS: $243.00 (apply cash bail)

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (apply cash bail).  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.


COUNT 3:

HUBER: 60 Days with standard release conditions (consecutive to 15CF589 and Count #2).

FINE: $1179.00 (apply cash bail).

DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 (apply cash bail and balance to be applied to 15CF589). Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

D/L REVOCATION: 12 MONTHS;

Request for expunction is denied by the Court.
Character and completion letters.
